business.headline: NRIs face double tax if they miss filing this form. Check detailsNRIs may face double taxation on the same income if their claim for tax relief under DTAA is denied.

Bizarre IPOs of 2024: SME listings that no one saw comingWhile mainboard IPOs are the ones which attract the big bucks, the trend this year has been different with retail inventors breaking their banks for SME IPOs in a bizarre phenomenon.

Reliance Industries approves 1:1 bonus shares for shareholdersThe announcement was made following the company's annual general meeting (AGM), where chairman Mukesh Ambani, had hinted at this move as a way to reward investors.
Sensex, Nifty end lower as cautious investors await US economic dataThe S&P BSE Sensex lost 151.48 points to close at 82,201.16, while the NSE Nifty50 ended 53.60 points lower to end at 25,145.10.

Rapido becomes India's latest unicorn with $1.1 billion valuation The latest funding round saw participation from investors including WestBridge Capital, Think Investments and Invus Opportunities, alongside existing investor Nexus Ventures.
Rama Steel Tubes shares jump 20% today. Here's why Rama Steel has developed specialised steel structures and tracker tubes that are crucial for the long-term success of solar projects.
Explained: Why Suzlon Energy shares jumped on 4% todaySuzlon Energy's stock rose 3.03% to Rs 76.43 on the BSE at 1:42 pm, after reaching an intraday high of Rs 77 earlier.
Ola Electric shares jump 5% today. Will the rally continue?Ola Electric share price: Brokerage firm Anand Rathi has said that the stock looks "oversold" and that it has great potential.

RIL board set to approve 1st bonus issue since 2017 today. Check detailsThe oil-to-telecom giant, led by Mukesh Ambani, is expected to propose a 1:1 bonus share issue, where investors will receive one bonus share for each share they own.

Shree Tirupati Balajee IPO opens for bidding: Should you subscribe?Shree Tirupati Balajee's IPO is a book-built issue comprising a fresh issue of 1.48 crore shares totalling Rs 122.43 crore and an offer for sale of 57 lakh shares amounting to Rs 47.23 crore.

GST Council may reduce tax rates on life, health insurance premiums: ReportThe GST Council is expected to review recommendations from the fitment panel, which has been examining the 18% GST rate on health and life insurance products.

New GST filing rules apply from September 2024: All you need to know These new rules include adjustments to the reporting of high-value transactions, the validation of bank accounts, and an important update allowing the reporting of negative liability.

Explained: Why Zomato shares surged over 7% in early tradeZomato share price: The food delivery giant's shares have surged in 2024, fuelled by optimistic brokerage outlooks, particularly for its quick commerce unit, Blinkit.

54th GST Council meeting: What's on the agenda?These meetings have focused on various important issues, including tax rates on hybrid vehicles, life insurance premiums, and challenges within the textiles and pharmaceuticals sectors.

Another SME IPO in spotlight over 135x subscription. Details hereBoss Packing Solutions, which supplies packaging machines, labelling, capping, and filling equipment, had an issue size of a little over Rs 8 crore.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: Insult to Shivaji Maharaj: Rahul Gandhi jabs PM Modi over statue collapseRahul Gandhi indicated that the Prime Minister might have apologised after realising that there was corruption in the construction of the 35-foot statue of Shivaji Maharaj.

Day after doctor's murder, ex-RG Kar principal ordered renovation in hospitalRG Kar Doctor Rape-Murder: India Today has exclusively accessed a letter written by Sandip Ghosh to the PWD, asking them for repairs and renovation of on-duty doctors' rooms in RG Kar Hospital.

UP forest official cites 'revenge' angle behind wolves turning into man-eatersSanjay Pathak, general manager of UP Forest Corporation, said wolves have a tendency to seek revenge if their homes or children have been harmed.

GOAT Review: Brilliant Vijay shoulders Venkat Prabhu's film with wafer-thin plotGOAT Review: Director Venkat Prabhu's spy thriller features Thalapathy Vijay, Prashanth and Prabhudheva, among others. The director whips up a tribute film for Vijay but struggles with a basic storyline.

What does an Okinawa diet tweaked for the Indian plate look likeFrom Japan to your plate, the Okinawa diet can be easily adapted for Indians by incorporating similar principles. Experts are here to guide you.

Tamil actors' body proposes to ban sex offenders from film industry for 5 yearsThe committee recommends a five-year ban on perpetrators of sexual offences in the Tamil film industry if a complaint lodged by a person is found to be true after thorough investigation.

Thalapathy is GOAT, Diljit is GOAT, but who's the OG GOAT?Thalapathy Vijay's last film before he takes the political plunge was released on Thursday. It is called GOAT. Vijay is GOAT, Punjabi singer Diljit Dosanjh is GOAT, as are Virat Kohli and Roger Federer. But who is the OG GOAT? When and for whom was the acronym first used?

Arvind Kejriwal bail plea arguments over, Supreme Court order likely on TuesdayThe Supreme Court has reserved its order on the bail plea of Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal in the liquor policy case.

Why Jagmeet Singh's NDP stopped being Trudeau's BFFThe New Democratic Party (NDP) was the BFF that Justin Trudeau's Liberal Party of Canada needed as no party got an absolute majority in 2021. However, the friendship didn't last till mid-2025 as was planned. This is why Jagmeet Singh ditched Trudeau and distanced his NDP from the Liberals ahead of the election in 2025.

Sathyabama welcomes the Yorker Champion Jasprit BumrahIn a memorable event, Sathyabama University had the honour of hosting one of India's most celebrated cricket icons, Mr. Jasprit Bumrah. The university's President, Dr. Marie Johnson, and Chancellor, Dr. Mariazeena Johnson, warmly welcomed the champion fast bowler, renowned for his impeccable yorkers, to the campus.

The atmosphere was electric as students gathered in large numbers, eager to catch a glimpse of the cricket sensation. Their excitement and enthusiasm were palpable, reflecting the immense respect and admiration they hold for Bumrah. His visit not only inspired the students but also created an unforgettable experience, further strengthening the bond between sports and academia at Sathyabama University.

Shirtless, pleading for life: Last moments of Darshan's fan before murderIn both the images, Renukaswamy is not wearing a shirt, while there are parked trucks in the background. An injury mark can also been seen on his body.

Not just the names, Anubhav Sinha's IC 814 hijacked several factsAnubhav Sinha's IC 814 - The Kandahar Hijack, streaming on Netflix, has been hauled over the coals for not sticking to facts. It isn't just about the names of the five IC 814 hijackers, passengers of that flight, and experts have called out the series for several inconsistencies, including the role of ISI, RAW intel, and the portrayal of the hijackers.
The whats and whys of Bahraich horror and how to deal with itIn the long term, we need to address not only wolf attacks but most wildlife-human conflicts.
Cricketer Ravindra Jadeja joins BJPRavindra Jadeja's wife is BJP MLA from Jamnagar seat. Now, the ace cricketer has also made his entry into politics, joining the party.

IC 814 hijack: Who's the terrorist whose body hijackers sought?Among the initial demands of the five IC 814 hijackers was the body of a terrorist who was buried six months earlier. The terrorist whose body they were demanding was Sajjad Afghani, killed in Jammu in July 1999. Who was Afghani?

Woman raped, murdered in Karnataka's Bidar; 3 arrested, protests eruptAccording to information, the woman was reported missing on August 29 and her body was recovered on September 1 in the bushes near a government primary school in Bidar's Gunatheerthawadi area.

Sunita Williams removes seats from Starliner spacecraft, loads cargoThe veteran space travelers focused on loading cargo and conducting final inspections of the capsule, which is set to depart the International Space Station on Friday.

Why women are critical of IndiGo's women-friendly seatsIndiGo is running a pilot project that allows women to choose seats that are next to women flyers. The airline is saying there is huge interest in 'women-friendly' seats. However, several women have raised questions about the policy, including if those who don't choose a seat next to a woman would be seen inviting misbehaviour.
Video: Bengaluru auto driver slaps female passenger for cancelling ride Bystanders and the auto driver in Bengaluru did nothing as the man continued to threaten them.

India, China, Brazil could mediate Russia-Ukraine peace talks: Vladimir PutinRussian President Vladimir Putin said that China, India, and Brazil could mediate peace talks over Ukraine. He referred to a preliminary agreement reached in Istanbul as a possible foundation for future negotiations.

'GOAT vs OG': Makers of Thalapathy Vijay's film hint at sequel in end credits The makers of 'The Greatest of All Time' left enough room for the possibility of the film's sequel. The current film stars Thalapathy Vijay, and it will be interesting to see if he decides to return for this possible sequel.

Day 8 Live: Archers in mixed team quarters, Simran reaches 100m finalParalympics 2024, Day 8 Live: Harvinder Singh and Pooja reach the semi-final of the mixed team archery recurve event with a 6-0 win over Poland. Earlier in the day, India's Simran qualified for the final for the Women's 100m T12 Final.

Kolkata doctor's family claims police tried to suppress case, 'bribe them'The family of the doctor who was raped and murdered at Kolkata hospital accused the West Bengal police of covering up the case by hurriedly cremating her body and attempting to bribe them.

Sinners have no right to test you: Yogeshwar Dutt after BJP poll ticket snubYogeshwar Dutt told reporters last week that he had informed the Haryana Chief Minister and the Central leadership of his willingness to contest from the Gohana Assembly seat.

Joker Folie a Deux first reviews: Unnecessary and underwhelming, say criticsThe first reviews of the highly-anticipated 'Joker: Folie a Deux' are here. The reactions have largely been negative, with many calling out the plot and direction of the film.

Eminent film critic Aruna Vasudev dies at 88Aruna Vasudev, renowned as the 'mother of Asian cinema,' died at the age of 88 due to age-related health issues. She was a pioneering figure in global cinema, who founded 'Cinemaya' and Netpac, and was honoured by the French government for her contributions.

'Queen Woo' Review: Strong performances fall short of redeeming show's flawsReleased-Thu Aug 29, 2024'Queen Woo' is a period drama that has sparked debate among viewers. With phenomenal performances and controversial scenes, it offers a mix of intrigue and criticism. Read the full review here.

Salman Khan's bodyguard Shera declares unwavering loyalty to the actorShera, Salman Khan's long-time bodyguard, reaffirmed his loyalty to the Bollywood superstar, despite providing security to other A-list actors. He shared insights on their close bond and professional relationship.

sports.headline: Rishabh Pant back in whites? Test selection chatter begins | Sledging Room, S02 Ep 51The Duleep Trophy marked the start of India's domestic season. The first round of the domestic four-day competition will be crucial as the senior selection committee will be keeping an eye on Test regulars and looking to pick back-up options for the upcoming long Test season. is Rishabh Pant an automatic choice for the Test team? Is Shreyas Iyer still in the fray for a middle-order spot? Akshay Ramesh, Suarabh Kumar and Kingshuk Kusari discuss the chatter around Test selection in the latest episode of the Sledging Room podcast. Tune In!

We are also strong, bad: Jessica Andrade speaks about a women's BMF belt in UFCJessica Andrade, during an exclusive interaction with Indiatoday.in, opened up about why she has been advocating for the creation of the women's BMF belt in UFC. Andrade will face Natalia Silva in the co-main event of the UFC Fight Night: Burns vs Brady on Saturday, September 7.

Day 1: Musheer Khan announces his arrival on big stage with Bengaluru rescue actDuleep Trophy 2024: Musheer Khan announced he is ready for the big league with a gritty hundred that saw India B recover from 94 for 7 and head to Stumps at 202 for 7 on Day 1 of the domestic first-class competition in Bengaluru.

Axar Patel prepares for crisis man role ahead of busy Test season Axar Patel showcased his resilience and skill with a crucial 86-run knock, rescuing India D from a precarious situation in their Duleep Trophy match against India C. Axar's performance highlighted his growing reputation as India's crisis man with the bat.

After leaving England job, Matthew Mott becomes Sydney Sixers assistant coachAfter leaving his job as the head coach of the Englands white-ball teams, Matthew Mott has made a return to Sydney in a new role. Mott will join the Sydney Sixers as the new assistant coach of the franchise for the new season.

Watch: Sarfaraz celebrates brother Musheer Khan's gritty hundred on debut Duleep Trophy 2024: 19-year-old Musheer Khan single-handedly rescued Team B out of trouble on Day 1 of the first round of Duleep Trophy in Bengaluru. Musheer hit a hundred after stitching a 100-plus stand for the eight wicket with Navdeep Saini. His brother, Sarfaraz, was thrilled to see the gritty knock.

Salt to lead England in T20Is vs Australia after injured Buttler ruled outEngland vs Australia: Captain Jos Buttler was ruled out of the upcoming three-match T20I series in September due to a calf injury. Phil Salt will lead the England side in his absence. Buttler is also doubtful for the five-match ODI series against Australia later this month.

Duleep Trophy: Axar Patel stranded on 86 as Shreyas Iyer's team 164-all outDuleep Trophy: Axar Patel missed out on his 2nd First Class hundred, but he rescued the India D team from a precarious situation of 34/5.  He led the recovery of Shreyas Iyer's team alongside Arshdeep Singh.

Singapore bowls out Mongolia for joint-lowest T20I total in T20 World Cup qualifierSingapore bowled out Mongolia for the joint lowest T20I total during 14th Match of the ICC Men's T20 World Cup Asia Qualifier A.

Watch: Rishabh Pant out cheaply on red-ball return after Shubman Gill's stunnerDuleep Trophy 2024, India A vs India B: Wicketkeeper-batter Rishabh Pant, playing his first red-ball match in nearly two years, managed just 7 on Day 1 of the first round of the tournament. He was dismissed by India A pacer Akash Deep after a stunning catch by opposition captain, Shubman Gill in Bengaluru.

Sarah Storey wins 18th Paralympic Gold at 46, breaking age and disability barriersBritain's Para-athlete Sarah Storey, a British Paralympian, secured her 18th gold medal at Paris Olympics 2024. She emerged victorious in the Women's C5 Time Trial cycling event.

Set on fire by boyfriend, Ugandan Olympic athlete dies in KenyaUgandan Olympian Rebecca Cheptegei, 33, died at a Kenyan hospital where she was being treated after sustaining 80 percent burns on her body. She was set on fire by her boyfriend during a disagreement over a land deal, police said.

Gracious in defeat, Medvedev calls Sinner 'one of the best' after US Open exitDaniil Medvedev was gracious in defeat as he called Jannik Sinner one of the best players after the former US Open champion suffered an exit in the quarter-final. Sinner advanced to semi-final of the US Open 2024.

Sumit Antil recalls sleepless night before Paralympic glory in ParisIndia's Sumit Antil recalls his sleepless night before breaking the Paralympics Javelin Throw Record in Paris. Antil successfully defended his gold with a 70.59m throw.

Watch: Afghanistan gives warm welcome to Kiwis as they arrive in Greater NoidaThe Tim Southee-led New Zealand team received a warm and Afghan-style welcome as they arrived in Greater Noida for one-off Test vs Afghanistan.

Sinner eager to face 'good friend' Draper in maiden US Open semis outingJannik Sinner opened up on facing Jake Draper in the US Open semi-final and admitted that the battle against his 'good friend' will be a tough one. Sinner reached his maiden US Open semi-final.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
